initial_question.title: [Discussion] Is there any way to release memory after separating is done??
initial_question.body:
I need to process multiple audio files in a loop.
I've been unable to find a solution to ensure that memory is properly released after the separation task is completed.
I'd greatly appreciate any insights, suggestions, or experiences.

satisfaction_conditions: Memory is released after each audio file processing

initial_question.title: the question of the audio separate time
initial_question.body:
Excuse me, is the separated audio file just the first ten minutes of audio?
What to do if the original audio is longer than ten minutes？

satisfaction_conditions: Audio processing duration must be configurable beyond the default 10 minutes
User must be informed about system resource limitations
Duration parameter must be adjustable through command options
Full audio file length must be processable if system resources allow

initial_question.title: [Discussion] Why files outputted by splitter is three times bigger than initial file?
initial_question.body:
<!-- Please respect the title [Discussion] tag. -->
Thanks for the awesome project guys. I am wondering why outputted files are much bigger than the initial file?
For example, my initial file was 9mb and the vocal I got after processing 36mb.

satisfaction_conditions: Output file size increase must be explained by technical audio parameters
Size increase ratio must be quantifiably justified
Audio quality parameters of output must be clearly specified
File size management options must be available

initial_question.title: [Discussion] Output in FLAC or other formats
initial_question.body:
Hi,
I was wondering if it is possible to to export the output files in other formats than WMA. I would be interested in having the files as FLAC, is it already possible to do so ?

I thank you in advance for your time and comprehension towards my request.

satisfaction_conditions: Audio output format can be changed to FLAC
Format selection mechanism is available to user
Multiple audio format options are supported

initial_question.title: [Discussion] How to correctly set bitrate?
initial_question.body:
I have set command in order to have vocal and accomaniment in flac format, at a bitrate of 320kbps in 'output' destination folder.
What I wrote:

`spleeter separate -i 'songName.flac' -p spleeter:2stems -c flac -b 320k -o output`

What i get is two flac files (ok), but with higher bitrate than the one request by parameter `-b 320k`

Is there something wrong in wrinting the command? How should the bitrate parameter be written? (there's no explanation on that by reading the manual)

satisfaction_conditions: User understands that bitrate cannot be manually set for FLAC format
Explanation clarifies why the -b parameter is ignored
User understands what determines the actual output bitrate
